papers.title: The Wiener index of vertex colorings
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a vertex coloring of a graph is defined to be the sum of all pairwise geodesic distances between vertices of the same color. We provide characterizations of vertex colorings of paths and cycles whose Wiener index is as large as possible over various natural collections. Along the...

papers.title: Peripheral hyper-Wiener index of a graph
papers.abstract: In this note, we introduce a new topological index of a graph G that we term peripheral hyper-Wiener index, denoted PWW(G). It is a natural extension of the peripheral Wiener index PW(G) initiated in [NB17] and is to the peripheral Wiener index what the hyper-Wiener index is to the Wiener index. We ...

papers.title: Graphs with a given conditional diameter that maximize the Wiener index
papers.abstract: The Wiener index $W(G)$ of a graph $G$ is one of the most well-known topological indices, which is defined as the sum of distances between all pairs of vertices of $G$. The diameter $D(G)$ of $G$ is the maximum distance between all pairs of vertices of $G$; the conditional diameter $D(G;s)$ is the m...

papers.title: Selected topics on Wiener index
papers.abstract: The Wiener index is defined as the sum of distances between all unordered pairs of vertices in a graph. It is one of the most recognized and well-researched topological indices, which is on the other hand still a very active area of research. This work presents a natural continuation of the paper Ma...

papers.title: The maximum Wiener index of a uniform hypergraph
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a (hyper)graph is calculated by summing up the distances between all pairs of vertices. We determine the maximum possible Wiener index of a connected $n$-vertex $k$-uniform hypergraph and characterize for every~$n$ all hypergraphs attaining the maximum Wiener index.

papers.title: Geometric Spanning Trees Minimizing the Wiener Index
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a network, introduced by the chemist Harry Wiener, is the sum of distances between all pairs of nodes in the network. This index, originally used in chemical graph representations of the non-hydrogen atoms of a molecule, is considered to be a fundamental and useful network descri...

papers.title: The Wiener index and the Wiener Complexity of the zero-divisor graph of a ring
papers.abstract: We calculate the Wiener index of the zero-divisor graph of a finite semisimple ring. We also calculate the Wiener complexity of the zero-divisor graph of a finite simple ring and find an upper bound for the Wiener complexity in the semisimple case.

papers.title: On the Wiener Index of Orientations of Graphs
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a strong digraph $D$ is defined as the sum of the distances between all ordered pairs of vertices. This definition has been extended to digraphs that are not necessarily strong by defining the distance from a vertex $a$ to a vertex $b$ as $0$ if there is no path from $a$ to $b$ i...

papers.title: Disproof of a conjecture on the minimum Wiener index of signed trees
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of distances between all unordered pairs of vertices. Sam Spiro [The Wiener index of signed graphs, Appl. Math. Comput., 416(2022)126755] recently introduced the Wiener index for a signed graph and conjectured that the path $P_n$ with alternating sign...

papers.title: On maximum Wiener index of directed grids
papers.abstract: This paper is devoted to Wiener index of directed graphs, more precisely of directed grids. The grid $G_{m,n}$ is the Cartesian product $P_m\Box P_n$ of paths on $m$ and $n$ vertices, and in a particular case when $m=2$, it is a called the ladder graph $L_n$. Kraner Šumenjak et al. proved that the m...

papers.title: Wiener index of the Cozero-divisor graph of a finite commutative ring
papers.abstract: Let $R$ be a ring with unity. The cozero-divisor graph of a ring $R$, denoted by $Γ'(R)$, is an undirected simple graph whose vertices are the set of all non-zero and non-unit elements of $R$, and two distinct vertices $x$ and $y$ are adjacent if and only if $x \notin Ry$ and $y \notin Rx$. In this ...

papers.title: Equiseparability on Terminal Wiener Index and Distances
papers.abstract: Teminal Wiener index is one of the commonly used topological index in mathematical chemistry. If two or more chemical compounds have the same terminal Wiener index then they will have similar physico-chemical properties. In this work we propose a new method for constructing equiseparable trees w.r.t...

papers.title: Proof of a Conjecture on the Wiener Index of Eulerian Graphs
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of the distances between all unordered pairs of vertices. A connected graph is Eulerian if its vertex degrees are all even. In [Gutman, Cruz, Rada, Wiener index of Eulerian Graphs, Discrete Applied Mathematics 132 (2014), 247-250] the authors proved t...

papers.title: Correction of a theorem in the Wiener index on fuzzy graphs
papers.abstract: In an article entitled The Counterexample of a theorem in Wiener index of a fuzzy graph and application to illegal immigration networks, we have shown a few examples of incorrect proof of a theorem in the Wiener index. Now, in this article, we will prove it by correcting the desired theorem. We have...

papers.title: On the Relation Between Wiener Index and Eccentricity of a Graph
papers.abstract: The relation between the Wiener index $W(G)$ and the eccentricity $\varepsilon(G)$ of a graph $G$ is studied. Lower and upper bounds on $W(G)$ in terms of $\varepsilon(G)$ are proved and extremal graphs characterized. A Nordhaus-Gaddum type result on $W(G)$ involving $\varepsilon(G)$ is given. A sha...

papers.title: Wiener index and Steiner 3-Wiener index of a graph
papers.abstract: Let $S$ be a set of vertices of a connected graph $G$. The Steiner distance of $S$ is the minimum size of a connected subgraph of $G$ containing all the vertices of $S$. The sum of all Steiner distances on sets of size $k$ is called the Steiner $k$-Wiener index, hence for $k=2$ we get the Wiener ind...

papers.title: The Edge-Wiener Index and the Edge-Hyper-Wiener Index of Phenylenes
papers.abstract: Besides the well known Wiener index, which sums up the distances between all the pairs of vertices, and the hyper-Wiener index, which includes also the squares of distances, the edge versions of both indices attracted a lot of attention in the recent years.   In this paper we consider the edge-Wiene...

papers.title: Generalizations of Wiener polarity index and terminal Wiener index
papers.abstract: In theoretical chemistry, distance-based molecular structure descriptors are used for modeling physical, pharmacologic, biological and other properties of chemical compounds. We introduce a generalized Wiener polarity index $W_k (G)$ as the number of unordered pairs of vertices ${u, v}$ of $G$ such ...

papers.title: On the Wiener complexity and the Wiener index of fullerene graphs
papers.abstract: Fullerenes are molecules in the form of cage-like polyhedra, consisting solely of carbon atoms. Fullerene graphs are mathematical models of fullerene molecules. The transmission of a vertex $v$ of a graph is the sum of distances from $v$ to all the other vertices. The number of different vertex tran...

papers.title: On the Two Conjectures of the Wiener Index
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a graph, which is the sum of the distances between all pairs of vertices, has been well studied. Recently, Sills and Wang in 2012 proposed two conjectures on the maximal Wiener index of trees with a given degree sequence. This note proves one of the two conjectures and disproves ...

papers.title: Properties of the Hyper-Wiener index as a local function
papers.abstract: Hyper-Wiener index was introduced as one of the main generalizations of the well known Wiener index. Through the years properties of the Wiener index have been extensively studied in both Mathematics and Chemistry. The Hyper-Wiener index, although received much attention, is far from being thoroughl...

papers.title: Wiener Index, Hyper-wiener Index, Harary Index and Hamiltonicity of graphs
papers.abstract: In this paper, we discuss the Hamiltonicity of graphs in terms of Wiener index, hyper-Wiener index and Harary index of their quasi-complement or complement. Firstly, we give some sufficient conditions for an balanced bipartite graph with given the minimum degree to be traceable and Hamiltonian, resp...

papers.title: Generalized cut method for computing the edge-Wiener index
papers.abstract: The edge-Wiener index of a connected graph $G$ is defined as the Wiener index of the line graph of $G$. In this paper it is shown that the edge-Wiener index of an edge-weighted graph can be computed in terms of the Wiener index, the edge-Wiener index, and the vertex-edge-Wiener index of weighted quo...

papers.title: Complexity to Find Wiener Index of Some Graphs
papers.abstract: The Wiener index is one of the oldest graph parameter which is used to study molecular-graph-based structure. This parameter was first proposed by Harold Wiener in 1947 to determining the boiling point of paraffin. The Wiener index of a molecular graph measures the compactness of the underlying mole...

papers.title: The Maximum Wiener Index of Trees with Given Degree Sequences
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of topological distances between all pairs of vertices. Since Wang gave a mistake result on the maximum Wiener index for given tree degree sequence, in this paper, we investigate the maximum Wiener index of trees with given degree sequences and extrem...

papers.title: Wiener index and Harary index on pancyclic graphs
papers.abstract: Wiener index and Harary index are two classic and well-known topological indices for the characterization of molecular graphs. Recently, Yu et al. \cite{YYSX} established some sufficient conditions for a graph to be pancyclic in terms of the edge number, the spectral radius and the signless Laplacia...

papers.title: Maximum Wiener index of unicyclic graphs with given bipartition
papers.abstract: The \emph{Wiener index} is a widely studied topological index of graphs. One of the main problems in the area is to determine which graphs of given properties attain the extremal values of Wiener index.   In this paper we resolve an open problem posed by Du in 2012. To this end we determine the unic...

papers.title: Minimum Wiener Index of Triangulations and Quadrangulations
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of the distances between all unordered pairs of vertices. We provide formulae for the minimum Wiener index of simple triangulations and quadrangulations with connectivity at least $c$, and provide the extremal structures, which attain those values. Ou...

papers.title: The Terminal Wiener Index of Trees with Diameter or Maximum Degree
papers.abstract: The terminal Wiener index of a tree is the sum of distances for all pairs of pendent vertices, which recently arises in the study of phylogenetic tree reconstruction and the neighborhood of trees. This paper presents a sharp upper and lower bounds for the terminal Wiener index in terms of its order ...

papers.title: Wiener index of graphs with fixed number of pendant or cut vertices
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is defined as the sum of the distances between all unordered pair of its vertices. In this paper, we characterize the graphs which extremize the Wiener index among all graphs on $n$ vertices with $k$ pendant vertices. We also characterize the graph which minimiz...

papers.title: Wiener index, number of subtrees, and tree eccentric sequence
papers.abstract: The eccentricity of a vertex $u$ in a connected graph $G$ is the distance between $u$ and a vertex farthest from it; the eccentric sequence of $G$ is the nondecreasing sequence of the eccentricities of $G$. In this paper, we determine the unique tree that minimises the Wiener index, i.e. the sum of ...

papers.title: The extremal values of the Wiener index of a tree with given degree sequence
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a graph is the sum of the distances between all pairs of vertices, it has been one of the main descriptors that correlate achemical compound's molecular graph with experimentally gathered data regarding the compound's characteristics. The tree that minimizes the Wiener index amon...

papers.title: On the difference between the Szeged and Wiener index
papers.abstract: We prove a conjecture of Nadjafi-Arani, Khodashenas and Ashrafi on the difference between the Szeged and Wiener index of a graph. Namely, if $G$ is a 2-connected non-complete graph on $n$ vertices, then $Sz(G)-W(G)\ge 2n-6$. Furthermore, the equality is obtained if and only if $G$ is the complete gr...

papers.title: Wiener index, Harary index and Hamiltonicity of graphs
papers.abstract: In this paper, we prove tight sufficient conditions for traceability and Hamiltonicity of connected graphs with given minimum degree, in terms of Wiener index and Harary index. We also prove some result on Hamiltonicity of balanced bipartite graphs in the similar fashion. In two recent papers \cite{...

papers.title: An upper bound on the Wiener Index of a k-connected graph
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the summation of all distances between unordered pairs of vertices of the graph. In this paper, we give an upper bound on the Wiener index of a $k$-connected graph $G$ of order $n$ for integers $n-1>k \ge 1$:   \[W(G) \le \frac{1}{4} n \lfloor \frac{n+k-2}{k}...

papers.title: The Wiener Index of Unicyclic Graphs with Girth and the Matching Number
papers.abstract: In this paper, we investigate how the Wiener index of unicyclic graphs varies with graph operations. These results are used to present a sharp lower bound for the Wiener index of unicyclic graphs of order $n$ with girth and the matching number $β\ge \frac{3g}{2}$. Moreover, we characterize all extre...

papers.title: Steiner Wiener index of block graphs
papers.abstract: Let $S$ be a set of vertices of a connected graph $G$. The Steiner distance of $S$ is the minimum size of a connected subgraph of $G$ containing all the vertices of $S$. The Steiner $k$-Wiener index is the sum of all Steiner distances on sets of $k$ vertices of $G$. Different simple methods for calc...

papers.title: The Maximum Wiener Index of Maximal Planar Graphs
papers.abstract: The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of the distances between all pairs of vertices in the graph. It was conjectured that the Wiener index of an $n$-vertex maximal planar graph is at most $\lfloor\frac{1}{18}(n^3+3n^2)\rfloor$. We prove this conjecture and for every $n$, $n \geq 10$, det...

papers.title: Maximizing Wiener Index for Trees with Given Vertex Weight and Degree Sequences
papers.abstract: The Wiener index is maximized over the set of trees with the given vertex weight and degree sequences. This model covers the traditional "unweighed" Wiener index, the terminal Wiener index, and the vertex distance index. It is shown that there exists an optimal caterpillar. If weights of internal ve...

papers.title: The structure of graphs with given number of blocks and the maximum Wiener index
papers.abstract: The Wiener index (the distance) of a connected graph is the sum of distances between all pairs of vertices. In this paper, we study the maximum possible value of this invariant among graphs on $n$ vertices with fixed number of blocks $p$. It is known that among graphs on $n$ vertices that have just ...

papers.title: Wiener index of binomial trees and Fibonacci trees
papers.abstract: We obtain a closed-form expression for the Wiener index of binomial trees. We outline efficient algorithms for computing the Wiener indices of Fibonacci and binary Fibonacci trees.

papers.title: The quotients between the (revised) Szeged index and Wiener index of graphs
papers.abstract: Let $Sz(G),Sz^*(G)$ and $W(G)$ be the Szeged index, revised Szeged index and Wiener index of a graph $G.$ In this paper, the graphs with the fourth, fifth, sixth and seventh largest Wiener indices among all unicyclic graphs of order $n\geqslant 10$ are characterized; as well the graphs with the firs...

papers.title: Computing the Wiener index in Sierpinski carpet graphs
papers.abstract: We describe an algorithm to compute the Wiener index of a sequence of finite graphs approximating the Sierpinski carpet.

papers.title: The Steiner Wiener index of trees with a given segment sequence
papers.abstract: The Steiner distance of vertices in a set $S$ is the minimum size of a connected subgraph that contain these vertices. The sum of the Steiner distances over all sets $S$ of cardinality $k$ is called the Steiner $k$-Wiener index and studied as the natural generalization of the famous Wiener index in ...

papers.title: Mathematical aspects of Wiener index
papers.abstract: The Wiener index (i.e., the total distance or the transmission number), defined as the sum of distances between all unordered pairs of vertices in a graph, is one of the most popular molecular descriptors. In this article we summarize some results, conjectures and problems on this molecular descript...

papers.title: Wiener Index and Remoteness in Triangulations and Quadrangulations
papers.abstract: Let $G$ be a a connected graph. The Wiener index of a connected graph is the sum of the distances between all unordered pairs of vertices. We provide asymptotic formulae for the maximum Wiener index of simple triangulations and quadrangulations with given connectivity, as the order increases, and ma...

papers.title: A note on 'A New Approach To Compute Wiener Index'
papers.abstract: In this note, we discuss the method explained in the recent paper [P. Manuel, I. Rajasingh, B. Rajan, R. Sundara Rajan, A New Approach To Compute Wiener Index, Journal of Computational and Theoretical Nanoscience 10, (2013) 1515-1521.] for computing the Wiener index of special chemical graphs. The m...

papers.title: Wiener index in graphs with given minimum degree and maximum degree
papers.abstract: Let $G$ be a connected graph of order $n$.The Wiener index $W(G)$ of $G$ is the sum of the distances between all unordered pairs of vertices of $G$. In this paper we show that the well-known upper bound $\big( \frac{n}{δ+1}+2\big) {n \choose 2}$ on the Wiener index of a graph of order $n$ and minimu...

papers.title: On the Wiener index, distance cospectrality and transmission regular graphs
papers.abstract: In this paper, we investigate various algebraic and graph theoretic properties of the distance matrix of a graph. Two graphs are $D$-cospectral if their distance matrices have the same spectrum. We construct infinite pairs of $D$-cospectral graphs with different diameter and different Wiener index. ...

papers.title: Some Aspects of the Wiener Index for Sun Graphs
papers.abstract: The Wiener index $W(G)$ is the sum of distances of all pairs of vertices of the graph $G$. The Wiener polarity index $W_{p}(G)$ of a graph $G$ is the number of unordered pairs of vertices $u$ and $v$ of $G$ such that the distance $d_{G}(u,v)$ between $u$ and $v$ is $3$. In this paper the Wiener and ...
